item.title: Gary add a quote by charles bukowski
item.description:
"There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out but I'm too tough for him, I say, stay in there, I'm not going to let anybody see you.
there's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out but I pur whiskey on him and inhale cigarette smoke and the whores and the bartenders and the grocery clerks never know that he's in there. there's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out but I'm too tough for him, I say, stay down, do you want to mess me up? you want to screw up the works? you want to blow my book sales in Europe?
there's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out but I'm too clever, I only let him out at night sometimes when everybody's asleep. I say, I know that you're there, so don't be sad. then I put him back, but he's singing a little in there, I haven't quite let him die and we sleep together like that with our secret pact and it's nice enough to make a man weep, but I don't weep, do you?" -- charles bukowski

item.title: Gary add a quote by poor sparrow
item.description:
"<u>untitled</u>
flying's not so great i'd much rather masturbate" -- poor sparrow

item.title: Gary add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I only want sweet peace and kindliness when I awaken -- but there's always some finger pointing, telling me some terrible deed I committed during the night. It seems I make a lot of mistakes and it seems that I am not allowed any." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Gary add a quote by Andre Jordan
item.description: "i can't do this send help soon writes a boy in a spacesuit staring at the moon" -- Andre Jordan

item.title: Gary add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "A learned man is a sedentary, concentrated solitary enthusiast, who searches through books to discover some particular grain of truth upon which he has set his heart. If the passion for reading conquers him, his gains dwindle and vanish between his fingers. A reader, on the other hand, must check the desire for learning at the outset; if knowledge sticks to him well and good, but to go in pursuit of it, to read on a system, to become a specialist or an authority, is very apt to kill what suits us to consider the more humane passion for pure and disinterested reading." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Gary add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Gary add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Each has his past shut in him like the leaves of a book known to him by heart and his friends can only read the title." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Gary add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Sometimes you just have to pee in the sink." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Gary add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Great art is horseshit, buy tacos." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Gary add a quote by Hart Crane
item.description: "Love: a burnt match skating in a urinal. " -- Hart Crane

item.title: Gary add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Gary add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Gary add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "Why pamper life's complexities when the leather runs smooth on the passenger seat?" -- Morrissey

item.title: Gary add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "There's more to life than books, you know. But not much more." -- Morrissey

item.title: Gary add a quote by Morrissey
item.description:
"Young bones groan And the rocks below say, "Throw your white body down!"
But I'm going to meet the one I love At last" -- Morrissey

item.title: Gary add a quote by Mykle Hansen
item.description: "As long as there are things and idiots, idiots will break things." -- Mykle Hansen
